Brush and floss regularly: Even without dentists, the most basic oral care still applies. Brushing your teeth twice a day and flossing once a day can help prevent tooth decay and gum disease.
Use over-the-counter products: There are a variety of over-the-counter products available that can help maintain dental hygiene. These include toothpaste, mouthwash, and dental floss.

Visit a hygienist: Dental hygienists are trained professionals who can help clean and maintain teeth. While they may not be able to fill cavities or perform other dental procedures, they can still provide important oral care.
Make your own dental tools: With some basic materials, such as dental floss and a toothpick, you can create your own dental tools to help clean and maintain your teeth.

Learn basic dental procedures: While it's not advisable to try to fill cavities or perform other dental procedures yourself, there are some basic dental procedures that you can learn to do at home. For example, you can learn how to remove plaque and tartar from your teeth using a toothbrush and floss.
